intro: Catimbium malaccense, commonly known as the Malacca catimbium, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or pink flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
